article.headline: Miami (Ohio) 64, Buffalo 57
article.story: OXFORD, Ohio (AP) -- Kenny Hayes scored 20 points to lead Miami of Ohio to a 64-57 win over Buffalo on Sunday. Tim Pollitz added 18 points for the RedHawks (7-9, 1-3), while Eric Pollitz contributed 10. Miami of Ohio trailed 31-29 at halftime and was behind halfway through the second half, but the RedHawks caused two Buffalo turnovers and followed those up with fast-break lay-ups to take a 47-44 lead with 9:53 to go. Miami led the rest of the game. Sean Smiley led Buffalo (6-10, 0-4) with 13 points and Calvin Betts had 12. Miami got the win despite poor shooting. The RedHawks shot just 37 percent from the field, including 1-for-12 (8 percent) from behind the 3-point line. Buffalo shot just 35 percent from the field.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
